AbstractText.sentence: Nuclear factor (NF)-kappa B is a redox sensitive cytosolic transcription factor.

event.clue: Nuclear factor (NF)-kappa B is a redox sensitive cytosolic transcription factor.

AbstractText.sentence: Redox regulation of NF-kappa B has been implicated in the activation of the human immuno-deficiency virus (HIV).

AbstractText.sentence: Therefore, inhibition of NF-kappa B activation may be an effective strategy for acquired immunodeficiency syndrome therapy.

AbstractText.sentence: Anetholdithiolthione (ADT, 5-[p-methoxyphenyl]-3H-1,2-dithiol-3-thione) is an antioxidant which has been used to protect against acetaminophen- and CCl4-induced hepatotoxicity, lipid peroxidation, radiation injury, and also has been used clinically as an anti-choleretic agent.

AbstractText.sentence: The present study examined the effect of ADT pretreatment on NF-kappa B activation in response to a variety of stimuli such as H2O2, phorbol myristate acetate (PMA) or tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF alpha).

AbstractText.sentence: PMA and TNF alpha induced activation of (NF)-kappa B in human Jurkat T-cells was partially inhibited by ADT (0.1 mM) pretreatment.
